title: Circular Motion
content:
Circular Motion

ðŸ”¥ The Spark

Did you know that even when a ceiling fan blade spins at constant speed, it is constantly accelerating? How can that be? Because in circular motion, the direction keeps changing â€” and changing direction means changing velocity â€” which means acceleration!

ðŸ’¡ The Simple Core

In uniform circular motion, speed is constant but velocity changes direction continuously. This requires a centripetal force directed towards the centre of the circle. Formula: F = mvÂ²/r, where m is mass, v is speed, r is radius. Examples: Earth orbiting the Sun, a bike turning a corner, a stone tied to a string swung in a circle.

ðŸŽ¯ The Show

When you swing a stone tied to a string, the string provides the centripetal force pulling the stone inward. If the string breaks, the stone flies off in a straight line (tangent). On India's highway curves, banked roads are designed so that vehicles can safely turn using the component of the normal force as centripetal force â€” this is why mountain roads are tilted!
